AWS::StackId.description: Returns the ID of the stack.

AWS::StackName.description: Returns the name of the stack.

AWS::NotificationARNs.description: Returns the list of notification Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) for the current stack.

AWS::Region.description: Returns a string representing the AWS Region in which the encompassing resource is being created.

Fn::GetAZs.description: The intrinsic function Fn::GetAZs returns an array that lists all Availability Zones for the specified region.

Fn::Select.description: The intrinsic function Fn::Select returns a single object from a list of objects by index.

Ref.description: The intrinsic function Ref returns the value of the specified parameter or resource.

Fn::Base64.description: The intrinsic function Fn::Base64 returns the Base64 representation of the input string. This function is typically used to pass encoded data to Amazon EC2 instances by way of the UserData property.

Fn::Join.description: The intrinsic function Fn::Join appends a set of values into a single value, separated by the specified delimiter. If a delimiter is the empty string, the set of values are concatenated with no delimiter.

Fn::FindInMap.description: The intrinsic function Fn::FindInMap returns the value of a key from a mapping declared in the Mappings section.

Fn::GetAtt.description: The intrinsic function Fn::GetAtt returns the value of an attribute from a resource in the template.

Outputs.description: The optional Outputs section enables you to return one or more values to the user.

Value.description: The value of the property that is returned.

Description.description: A String type up to 4K in length describing the output value.

Parameters.description: The optional Parameters section enables you to pass values into your template at stack creation time. Parameters allow you to create templates that can be customized for each stack deployment. When a user creates a stack from a template containing parameters, the user can specify values for those parameters. Within the template, you can use the "Ref" intrinsic function to specify those parameter values in properties values for resources.

Default.description: A value of the appropriate type for the template to use if no value is specified at stack creation.

NoEcho.description: If TRUE, the value of the parameter is masked with asterisks (*****) with cfn-describe-stacks.

AllowedValues.description: An array containing the list of values allowed for the parameter.

MaxLength.description: A integer value that determines the maximum number of characters in the parameter's string value.

MinValue.description: A numeric value that determines the smallest numeric value allowed for the parameter.

Description.description: A String type up to 4000 characters describing the parameter.

Type.description: The type of parameter to create.

ConstraintDescription.description: A String type that describes the constraint requirements when the user specifies a parameter value that does not match the constraints defined for the parameter.

MaxValue.description: A numeric value that determines the largest numeric value allowed for the parameter.

MinLength.description: A integer value that determines the minimum number of characters in the parameter's string value.

AllowedPattern.description: A regular expression that represents the patterns allowed in the parameter's string value.

Description.description: The template Description section is optional. When it is present, it must follow the AWSTemplateFormatVersion section.

Mappings.description: Mappings match a key to a corresponding set of named values. For example, if you want to set values based on a region, you can create a mapping that uses the region name as a key and contains the values you want to specify for each specific region.

AWSTemplateFormatVersion.description: The template format version is an optional declaration that identifies the capabilities of the template format. Because the AWS CloudFormation template format has not changed, there is currently only one value supported.

Resources.description: The required Resources section describes the member resources in your AWS CloudFormation template.

return-values.description: Returns the value of this object's SubnetId property.
return-values.name: AssociationId

VisibilityTimeout.description: The length of time during which the queue will be unavailable once a message is delivered from the queue. This blocks other components from receiving the same message and gives the initial component time to process and delete the message from the queue. Values must be from 0 to 43200 seconds (12 hours). If no value is specified, the default value of 30 seconds will be used.

AWS::EC2::Volume.description: The AWS::EC2::Volume type creates a new Elastic Block Store volume. You can set a deletion policy for your volume to control how AWS CloudFormation handles the volume when the stack is deleted. For Elastic Block Store volumes, you can choose to retain the volume, to delete the volume, or to create a snapshot of the volume.

Type.description: The AWS::EC2::Volume type creates a new Elastic Block Store volume. You can set a deletion policy for your volume to control how AWS CloudFormation handles the volume when the stack is deleted. For Elastic Block Store volumes, you can choose to retain the volume, to delete the volume, or to create a snapshot of the volume.

Key.description: The key term for this item.

VolumeType.description: The volume type. This can be either "standard" or "io1". If no value is specified, "standard" will be used.

Iops.description: The number of I/O operations per second (IOPS) that the volume supports. This can be any value from 1–1000. Required: Conditional. Required when the volume type is "io1"; not used with standard volumes.

SnapshotId.description: The snapshot from which to create the new volume. Required: Conditional. Required if you are creating a volume from a snapshot. If you do not specify a value for SnapshotId, you should specify a value for Size.

AvailabilityZone.description: The Availability Zone in which to create the new volume.

Size.description: The size of the volume, in gibibytes (GiBs). This can be any value from 1–1024. Required: Conditional. Required if you are not creating a volume from a snapshot. If you specify Size, do not specify SnapshotId.

InstanceId.description: The ID of a NAT instance in your VPC. For example, "i-1a2b3c4d". Required: Conditional. You must provide only one of the following: a GatewayID, InstanceID, or NetworkInterfaceId.

NetworkInterfaceId.description: Allows the routing of network interface IDs. Required: Conditional. You must provide only one of the following: a GatewayID, InstanceID, or NetworkInterfaceId.

IamInstanceProfile.description: Provides the name or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the instance profile associated with the IAM role for the instance. The instance profile contains the IAM role.

ImageId.description: Provides the unique ID of the Amazon Machine Image (AMI) that was assigned during registration.

InstanceMonitoring.description: Indicates whether or not instance monitoring should be enabled for this autoscaling group. This is enabled by default. To turn it off, set InstanceMonitoring to "false".

RamdiskId.description: The ID of the RAM disk to select. Some kernels require additional drivers at launch. Check the kernel requirements for information about whether you need to specify a RAM disk. To find kernel requirements, refer to the AWS Resource Center and search for the kernel ID.

SecurityGroups.description: A list containing the EC2 security groups to assign to the Amazon EC2 instances in the Auto Scaling group. The list can contain the name of existing EC2 security groups, references to AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup resources created in the template, or both.

UserData.description: The user data available to the launched EC2 instances.

BlockDeviceMappings.description: Specifies how block devices are exposed to the instance. You can specify virtual devices and EBS volumes.

DeviceName.description: The name of the device within Amazon EC2.

Ebs.description: The information for the Elastic Block Store volume. If you specify the Ebs property, do not specify the VirtualName property.

VolumeSize.description: The volume size, in GigiBytes.  If you specify VolumeSize, do not specify SnapshotId.

SnapshotId.description: The Snapshot ID of the volume to use.  If you specify SnapshotId, do not specify VolumeSize.

VirtualName.description: The name of the virtual device. The name must be in the form ephemeralX where X is a number starting from 0, for example, ephemeral0. If you specify the VirtualName property, do not specify the Ebs property.

KeyName.description: Provides the name of the EC2 key pair.

SpotPrice.description: The spot price for this autoscaling group. If a spot price is set, then the autoscaling group will launch when the current spot price is less than the amount specified in the template.

AWS::Route53::RecordSetGroup.description: Creates or updates a new Amazon Route 53RecordSetGroup.

Type.description: Creates or updates a new Amazon Route 53RecordSetGroup.

DeletionPolicy.description: The DeletionPolicy attribute enables you to specify how AWS CloudFormation handles the resource deletion.

Metadata.description: The Metadata attribute enables you to associate structured data with a resource.

Version.description: This optional property sets the service API version number.

DependsOn.description: The DependsOn attribute enables you to specify that the creation of a specific resource follows another.

RecordSets.description: List of resource record sets to add.

Name.description: The name of the domain. This must be a fully-specified domain, ending with a period as the last label indication. If you omit the final period, Amazon Route 53 assumes the domain is relative to the root.

AliasTarget.description: Alias resource record sets only: Information about the domain to which you are redirecting traffic. Required: Conditional. Required if you are creating an alias resource record set.

HostedZoneId.description: The hosted zone name ID of the Load Balancer that is the target of the alias.

DNSName.description: The DNS name of the Load Balancer that is the target of the alias.

HostedZoneName.description: The name of the domain for the hosted zone where you want to add the record set. Required: Conditional. You must specify either the HostedZoneName or HostedZoneId, but you cannot specify both.

Region.description: Latency resource record sets only: The Amazon EC2 region where the resource that is specified in this resource record set resides. The resource typically is an AWS resource, for example, Amazon EC2 instance or an Elastic Load Balancing load balancer, and is referred to by an IP address or a DNS domain name, depending on the record type.

Weight.description: Weighted resource record sets only: Among resource record sets that have the same combination of DNS name and type, a value that determines what portion of traffic for the current resource record set is routed to the associated location. Required: Conditional. Required if you are creating a weighted resource record set.

Type.description: The type of records to add.

HostedZoneId.description: The ID of the hosted zone. Required: Conditional. You must specify either the HostedZoneName or HostedZoneId, but you cannot specify both.

Comment.description: Any comments you want to include about the hosted zone.

SetIdentifier.description: A unique identifier that differentiates among multiple resource record sets that have the same combination of DNS name and type. Required: Conditional. Required if you are creating a weighted resource record set.

TTL.description: The resource record cache time to live (TTL), in seconds. If TTL is specified, ResourceRecords is also required.

ResourceRecords.description: List of resource records to add. Each record should be in the format appropriate for the record type specified by the Type property. Required: Conditional. Required if TTL is specified.

HostedZoneName.description: The name of the domain for the hosted zone where you want to add the record set. Required: Conditional. You must specify either the HostedZoneName or HostedZoneId, but you cannot specify both.

HostedZoneId.description: The ID of the hosted zone. Required: Conditional: You must specify either the HostedZoneName or HostedZoneId, but you cannot specify both.

Comment.description: Any comments you want to include about the hosted zone.

AWS::ElasticLoadBalancing::LoadBalancer.description: The AWS::ElasticLoadBalancing::LoadBalancer type creates a LoadBalancer.

Type.description: The AWS::SNS::TopicPolicy type applies a policy to SNS topics.

DeletionPolicy.description: The DeletionPolicy attribute enables you to specify how AWS CloudFormation handles the resource deletion.

Metadata.description: The Metadata attribute enables you to associate structured data with a resource.

Version.description: This optional property sets the service API version number.

DependsOn.description: The DependsOn attribute enables you to specify that the creation of a specific resource follows another.

Policies.description: A list of elastic load balancing policies to apply to this elastic load balancer.

Attributes.description: A list of arbitrary attributes for this policy.

PolicyName.description: A name for this policy that is unique to the load balancer.

LoadBalancerPorts.description: A list of external load balancer ports for the policy.

InstancePorts.description: A list of instance ports for the policy. These are the ports associated with the back-end server.

PolicyType.description: The name of the policy type for this policy.

Scheme.description: For LoadBalancers attached to an Apazon VPC, this parameter can be used to specify the type of LoadBalancer to use. Specify "internal" to create an internal LoadBalancer with a DNS name that resolves to private IP addresses.

AvailabilityZones.description: The Availability Zones in which to create the load balancer. You can specify either AvailabilityZones or Subnets, but not both.

Listeners.description: One or more listeners for this load balancer. Each listener must be registered for a specific port, and you can not have more than one listener for a given port.

PolicyNames.description: A list of ElasticLoadBalancing policy names to associate with the listener.

LoadBalancerPort.description: Specifies the external LoadBalancer port number. This property cannot be modified for the life of the LoadBalancer.

InstancePort.description: Specifies the TCP port on which the instance server is listening. This property cannot be modified for the life of the LoadBalancer.

InstanceProtocol.description: Specifies the protocol to use for routing traffic to back-end instances—HTTP, HTTPS, TCP, or SSL. This property cannot be modified for the life of the load balancer.

SSLCertificateId.description: The ARN of the SSL certificate to use.

Protocol.description: Specifies the LoadBalancer transport protocol to use for routing — TCP or HTTP. This property cannot be modified for the life of the LoadBalancer.

Instances.description: Provides a list of EC2 instance IDs for the LoadBalancer.

Subnets.description: A list of subnet IDs in your virtual private cloud (VPC) to attach to your load balancer. You can specify either AvailabilityZones or Subnets, but not both.

HealthCheck.description: When specified, declares an application health check for the instances.

Timeout.description: Specifies the amount of time, in seconds, during which no response means a failed health probe. This value must be less than the value for Interval.

Interval.description: Specifies the approximate interval, in seconds, between health checks of an individual instance.

Target.description: Specifies the instance being checked. The protocol is either TCP or HTTP. The range of valid ports is 1 through 65535.

HealthyThreshold.description: Specifies the number of consecutive health probe successes required before moving the instance to the Healthy state.

UnhealthyThreshold.description: Specifies the number of consecutive health probe failures required before moving the instance to the Unhealthy state.

SecurityGroups.description: Security groups assigned to your load balancer within your virtual private cloud (VPC).

LBCookieStickinessPolicy.description: Generates a stickiness policy with sticky session lifetimes controlled by the lifetime of the browser (user-agent), or by a specified expiration period. This policy can be associated only with HTTP/HTTPS listeners.

CookieExpirationPeriod.description: The time period, in seconds, after which the cookie should be considered stale. If this parameter isn't specified, the sticky session will last for the duration of the browser session.

PolicyName.description: The name of the policy being created. The name must be unique within the set of policies for this load balancer.

AppCookieStickinessPolicy.description: Generates one or more stickiness policies with sticky session lifetimes that follow that of an application-generated cookie. These policies can be associated only with HTTP/HTTPS listeners.

ApplicationName.description: The name of the policy being created. The name must be unique within the set of policies for this Load Balancer.

CookieName.description: Name of the application cookie used for stickiness.

return-values.description: Returns the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the instance profile. For example: arn:aws:iam::1234567890:role/MyRole-AJJHDSKSDF.
return-values.name: Arn

ToPort.description: End of port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP code. An ICMP code of -1 indicates a wildcard.

FromPort.description: Start of port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP type number. An ICMP type number of -1 indicates a wildcard.

DestinationSecurityGroupId.description: For VPC security groups only. Specifies the ID of the Amazon EC2 Security Group to allow access.  If you specify CidrIp, do not specify SourceSecurityGroupId.

GroupId.description: ID of the Amazon VPC security group to modify. This value can be a reference to an AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup resource that has a valid VpcId property or the ID of an existing Amazon VPC security group.

CidrIp.description: The CIDR range. Required: Conditional—cannot be used when specifying a destination security group.

AWS::CloudWatch::Alarm.description: The AWS::CloudWatch::Alarm type creates an Amazon CloudWatch alarm.

Type.description: The AWS::CloudWatch::Alarm type creates an Amazon CloudWatch alarm.

DeletionPolicy.description: The DeletionPolicy attribute enables you to specify how AWS CloudFormation handles the resource deletion.

Metadata.description: The Metadata attribute enables you to associate structured data with a resource.

Version.description: This optional property sets the service API version number.

DependsOn.description: The DependsOn attribute enables you to specify that the creation of a specific resource follows another.

AlarmActions.description: The list of actions to execute when this alarm transitions into an ALARM state from any other state. Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource Number (ARN). Currently the only action supported is publishing to an Amazon SNS topic or an Amazon Auto Scaling policy.

Period.description: The period in seconds over which the specified statistic is applied.

Statistic.description: The statistic to apply to the alarm's associated metric.

MetricName.description: The name for the alarm's associated metric.

Threshold.description: The value against which the specified statistic is compared.

ActionsEnabled.description: Indicates whether or not actions should be executed during any changes to the alarm's state. Either true or false.

EvaluationPeriods.description: The number of periods over which data is compared to the specified threshold.

Dimensions.description: The dimensions for the alarm's associated metric.

Value.description: The value representing the dimension measurement.

Namespace.description: The namespace for the alarm's associated metric.

OKActions.description: The list of actions to execute when this alarm transitions into an OK state from any other state. Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource Number (ARN). Currently the only action supported is publishing to an Amazon SNS topic or an Amazon Auto Scaling policy.

InsufficientDataActions.description: The list of actions to execute when this alarm transitions into an INSUFFICIENT_DATA state from any other state. Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource Number (ARN). Currently the only action supported is publishing to an Amazon SNS topic or an Amazon Auto Scaling policy.

ComparisonOperator.description: The arithmetic operation to use when comparing the specified Statistic and Threshold. The specified Statistic value is used as the first operand.

Unit.description: The unit for the alarm's associated metric.

InstanceId.description: Instance ID of the Amazon EC2 instance that you want to associate with the Elastic IP address specified by the EIP property.

AllocationId.description: Allocation ID for the VPC Elastic IP address you want to associate with an Amazon EC2 instance in your VPC.

NetworkInterfaceId.description: The ID of the network interface to associate with the Elastic IP address (VPC only).

AWS::AutoScaling::Trigger.description: Creates an Auto Scaling trigger that determines when scaling activities should occur for the Auto Scaling group. This type does not support updates.

Type.description: Creates an Auto Scaling trigger that determines when scaling activities should occur for the Auto Scaling group. This type does not support updates.

DeletionPolicy.description: The DeletionPolicy attribute enables you to specify how AWS CloudFormation handles the resource deletion.

Metadata.description: The Metadata attribute enables you to associate structured data with a resource.

Version.description: This optional property sets the service API version number.

DependsOn.description: The DependsOn attribute enables you to specify that the creation of a specific resource follows another.

LowerBreachScaleIncrement.description: The incremental amount to use when performing scaling activities when the lower threshold has been breached.

Period.description: The period used in retrieving metric statistics used by the trigger to determine when to fire.

AutoScalingGroupName.description: The name of the Auto Scaling group.

Statistic.description: The statistic used by the trigger to determine which metric statistics to examine.

MetricName.description: The metric name used by the trigger to determine when to fire.

UpperBreachScaleIncrement.description: The incremental amount to use when performing scaling activities when the upper threshold has been breached. Must be a negative or positive integer, or integer percentage value.

LowerThreshold.description: The lower limit for the metric. The trigger fires if all data points in the last BreachDuration seconds exceed the upper threshold or fall below the lower threshold.

Dimensions.description: A list of CloudWatch dimensions used to retrieve metric statistics that the trigger uses to determine when to fire.

Value.description: The value representing the dimension measurement.

BreachDuration.description: The amount of time to wait while the trigger is firing before performing scaling activities in response to the breach.

Namespace.description: The namespace used by the trigger to determine when to fire.

UpperThreshold.description: The upper limit of the metric used. The trigger fires if all data points in the last BreachDuration seconds exceed the upper threshold or fall below the lower threshold.

Unit.description: The standard unit associated with a measure, used by the trigger when fetching the metric statistics it uses to determine when to activate.

AWS::EC2::Instance.description: The AWS::EC2::Instance type creates an Amazon EC2 instance.

Type.description: The AWS::EC2::Instance type creates an Amazon EC2 instance.

DeletionPolicy.description: The DeletionPolicy attribute enables you to specify how AWS CloudFormation handles the resource deletion.

Metadata.description: The Metadata attribute enables you to associate structured data with a resource.

Version.description: This optional property sets the service API version number.

DependsOn.description: The DependsOn attribute enables you to specify that the creation of a specific resource follows another.

IamInstanceProfile.description: A reference to an AWS::IAM::InstanceProfile type

ImageId.description: Provides the unique ID of the Amazon Machine Image (AMI) that was assigned during registration.

SourceDestCheck.description: Controls whether source/destination checking is enabled on the instance. Also determines if an instance in a VPC will perform network address translation (NAT).

AvailabilityZone.description: Specifies the name of the availability zone in which the instance is located. If not specified, the default availability zone for the region will be used.

SecurityGroups.description: Valid only for EC2 security groups. A list that contains the EC2 security groups to assign to the Amazon EC2 instance. The list can contain both the name of existing EC2 security groups or references to AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup resources created in the template.

UserData.description: Base64-encoded MIME user data that is made available to the instances.

EbsOptimized.description: This optimization provides dedicated throughput to Amazon EBS and an optimized configuration stack to provide optimal EBS I/O performance.

Tenancy.description: The tenancy of the instance that you want to launch. This value can be either "default" or "dedicated". An instance that has a tenancy value of "dedicated" runs on single-tenant hardware and can be launched only into a VPC.

Tags.description: The tags that you want to attach to the instance.

Value.description: A value associated with the key term.

Key.description: The key term for this item.

RamdiskId.description: The ID of the RAM disk to select. Some kernels require additional drivers at launch. Check the kernel requirements for information about whether you need to specify a RAM disk. To find kernel requirements, refer to the AWS Resource Center and search for the kernel ID.

SecurityGroupIds.description: A list that contains the security group IDs for VPC security groups to assign to the Amazon EC2 instance.

SubnetId.description: If you're using Amazon Virtual Private Cloud, this specifies the ID of the subnet that you want to launch the instance into.

DisableApiTermination.description: Specifies whether the instance can be terminated through the API (specify "true"), or not (specify "false").

PlacementGroupName.description: The name of an existing placement group that you want to launch the instance into (for cluster instances).

PrivateIpAddress.description: If you're using an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC), you can optionally use this parameter to assign the instance a specific available IP address from the subnet (e.g., 10.0.0.25). By default, Amazon VPC selects an IP address from the subnet for the instance.

Monitoring.description: Specifies whether monitoring is enabled for the instance.

KeyName.description: Provides the name of the EC2 key pair.

Volumes.description: The EBS volumes to attach to the instance.

Device.description: How the device is exposed to the instance (such as /dev/sdh, or xvdh).

VolumeId.description: The ID of the Amazon EBS volume. The volume and instance must be within the same Availability Zone and the instance must be running.

AWS::RDS::DBSecurityGroupIngress.description: The AWS::RDS::DBSecurityGroupIngress type enables ingress to a DBSecurityGroup using one of two forms of authorization.

Type.description: The AWS::RDS::DBSecurityGroupIngress type enables ingress to a DBSecurityGroup using one of two forms of authorization.

EC2SecurityGroupId.description: Id of the VPC or EC2 Security Group to authorize.

EC2SecurityGroupName.description: Name of the EC2 Security Group to authorize.

EC2SecurityGroupOwnerId.description: AWS Account Number of the owner of the EC2 Security Group specified in the EC2SecurityGroupName parameter. The AWS Access Key ID is not an acceptable value.

AWS::EC2::VPC.description: Creates a Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) with the CIDR block that you specify.

Type.description: Creates a Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) with the CIDR block that you specify.

DeletionPolicy.description: The DeletionPolicy attribute enables you to specify how AWS CloudFormation handles the resource deletion.

Metadata.description: The Metadata attribute enables you to associate structured data with a resource.

DependsOn.description: The DependsOn attribute enables you to specify that the creation of a specific resource follows another.

CidrBlock.description: The CIDR block you want the VPC to cover. For example: "10.0.0.0/16".

Tags.description: The tags that you want to attach to the instance.

Value.description: A value associated with the key term.

Key.description: The key term for this item.

InstanceTenancy.description: The allowed tenancy of instances launched into the VPC. A value of "default" means instances can be launched with any tenancy; a value of "dedicated" means instances must be launched with tenancy as dedicated.

AWS::EC2::RouteTable.description: Creates a new route table within a VPC. After you create a new route table, you can add routes and associate the table with a subnet.

Type.description: Creates a new route table within a VPC. After you create a new route table, you can add routes and associate the table with a subnet.

DeletionPolicy.description: The DeletionPolicy attribute enables you to specify how AWS CloudFormation handles the resource deletion.

Tags.description: The tags that you want to attach to the instance.

Value.description: A value associated with the key term.

VpcId.description: The ID of the VPC where the route table will be created.

AWS::AutoScaling::AutoScalingGroup.description: The AWS::AutoScaling::AutoScalingGroup type creates an Auto Scaling group.

Type.description: The AWS::AutoScaling::AutoScalingGroup type creates an Auto Scaling group.

DeletionPolicy.description: The DeletionPolicy attribute enables you to specify how AWS CloudFormation handles the resource deletion.

Metadata.description: The Metadata attribute enables you to associate structured data with a resource.

Version.description: This optional property sets the service API version number.

DependsOn.description: The DependsOn attribute enables you to specify that the creation of a specific resource follows another.

Tags.description: The tags you want to attach to this resource.

PropagateAtLaunch.description: Set to true if you want AWS CloudFormation to copy the tag to EC2 instances that are launched as part of the auto scaling group. Set to false if you want the tag attached only to the auto scaling group and not copied to any instances launched as part of the auto scaling group.

Value.description: The key name of the tag.

Key.description: The key name of the tag.

HealthCheckGracePeriod.description: The length of time in seconds after a new EC2 instance comes into service that Auto Scaling starts checking its health.

HealthCheckType.description: The service you want the health status from, Amazon EC2 or Elastic Load Balancer. Valid values are "EC2" or "ELB."

LoadBalancerNames.description: A list of load balancers associated with this auto scaling group.

AvailabilityZones.description: Contains a list of Availability Zones for the group.

DesiredCapacity.description: Specifies the desired capacity for the auto scaling group.

MaxSize.description: The maximum size of the auto scaling group.

VPCZoneIdentifier.description: A list of subnet identifiers of Amazon Virtual Private Clouds (Amazon VPCs).

Cooldown.description: The number of seconds after a scaling activity completes before any further scaling activities can start.

NotificationConfiguration.description: An embedded property that configures an auto scaling group to send notifications when specified events take place.

TopicARN.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS) topic.

NotificationTypes.description: The type of events that will trigger the notification.

LaunchConfigurationName.description: Specifies the name of the associated AWS::AutoScaling::LaunchConfiguration.

MinSize.description: The minimum size of the auto scaling group.

return-values.description: The ID that AWS assigns to represent the allocation of the address for use with Amazon VPC. THis is returned only for VPC elastic IP addresses. Example return value: eipalloc-5723d13e
return-values.name: AllocationId

Type.description: The AWS::EC2::EIP resource allocates an Elastic IP (EIP) address and can, optionally, associate it with an Amazon EC2 instance.

DependsOn.description: The DependsOn attribute enables you to specify that the creation of a specific resource follows another.

Domain.description: Set to "vpc" to allocate the address to your Virtual Private Cloud (VPC). No other values are supported.

InstanceId.description: The Instance ID of the Amazon EC2 instance that you want to associate with this Elastic IP address.

return-values.description: The domain name of the resource. For example: d2fadu0nynjpfn.cloudfront.net.
return-values.name: DomainName

AWS::CloudFront::Distribution.description: Creates an Amazon CloudFront download distribution.

Type.description: Creates an Amazon CloudFront download distribution.

DeletionPolicy.description: The DeletionPolicy attribute enables you to specify how AWS CloudFormation handles the resource deletion.

Metadata.description: The Metadata attribute enables you to associate structured data with a resource.

Version.description: This optional property sets the service API version number.

DependsOn.description: The DependsOn attribute enables you to specify that the creation of a specific resource follows another.

Logging.description: Controls whether access logs are written for the distribution. To turn on access logs, include this property.

Bucket.description: The Amazon S3 bucket to store the access logs in.

Prefix.description: An optional string that, if defined, will be used as a prefix for the access log file names for this distribution.

Aliases.description: CNAMEs (alternate domain names), if any, for the distribution.

Enabled.description: Controls whether the distribution is enabled to accept end user requests for content.

DefaultRootObject.description: The object (ex. "index.html") that you want CloudFront to request from your origin when the root URL for your distribution (ex. "http://example.com/") is requested.

Comment.description: Any comments you want to include about the distribution.

Origins.description: A list of origins for this CloudFront distribution. For each origin, you can specify whether it is an S3 or custom origin.

CustomOriginConfig.description: Origin information to specify a custom origin. Required: Conditional. You cannot use CustomOrigin and S3 Origin in the same distribution, but you must specify one or the other.

HTTPPort.description: The HTTP port the custom origin listens on.

OriginProtocolPolicy.description: The origin protocol policy to apply to your origin.

HTTPSPort.description: The HTTPS port the custom origin listens on.

DomainName.description: The DNS name of the Amazon S3 bucket or the HTTP server from which you want CloudFront to get objects for this origin.

Id.description: An identifier for the origin. The value of Id must be unique within the distribution.

S3OriginConfig.description: Origin information to specify an Amazon S3 origin. Required: Conditional. You cannot use S3Origin and CustomOrigin in the same distribution, but you must specify one or the other.

OriginAccessIdentity.description: The CloudFront origin access identity to associate with the origin. This is used to configure the origin so that end users can only access objects in an Amazon S3 bucket through CloudFront.

DefaultCacheBehavior.description: The default cache behavior that is triggered if you do not specify a CacheBehavior element, or if files don't match any of the values of PathPattern in CacheBehavior elements.

ViewerProtocolPolicy.description: Specifies the protocol that users can use to access the files in the origin specified by TargetOriginId when the default cache behavior is applicable to a request.

TargetOriginId.description: The value of ID for the origin that you want CloudFront to route requests to when the default cache behavior is applicable to a request.

MinTTL.description: The minimum amount of time that you want objects to stay in the cache before CloudFront queries your origin to see whether the object has been updated.

ForwardedValues.description: Specifies how CloudFront handles query strings.

QueryString.description: Indicates whether you want CloudFront to forward query strings to the origin that is associated with this cache behavior. If so, specify true; if not, specify false.

TrustedSigners.description: A list of AWS accounts that you want to allow to create signed URLs for private content.

ViewerProtocolPolicy.description: Specifies the protocol that users can use to access the files in the origin specified by TargetOriginId when the default cache behavior is applicable to a request.

TargetOriginId.description: The value of ID for the origin that you want CloudFront to route requests to when the default cache behavior is applicable to a request.

MinTTL.description: The minimum amount of time that you want objects to stay in the cache before CloudFront queries your origin to see whether the object has been updated.

ForwardedValues.description: Specifies how CloudFront handles query strings.

QueryString.description: Indicates whether you want CloudFront to forward query strings to the origin that is associated with this cache behavior. If so, specify true; if not, specify false.

TrustedSigners.description: A list of AWS accounts that you want to allow to create signed URLs for private content.

PathPattern.description: The pattern for which you want this cache behavior to apply (ex. "images/*.jpg"). When CloudFront receives an end-user request, the requested path is compared with path patterns in the order in which cache behaviors are listed in the stack specification for the distribution.

AWS::Route53::RecordSet.description: The AWS::Route53::RecordSet type can be used as a standalone resource or as an embedded property in the AWS::Route53::RecordSetGroup type.

Type.description: The AWS::Route53::RecordSet type can be used as a standalone resource or as an embedded property in the AWS::Route53::RecordSetGroup type.

DeletionPolicy.description: The DeletionPolicy attribute enables you to specify how AWS CloudFormation handles the resource deletion.

Metadata.description: The Metadata attribute enables you to associate structured data with a resource.

Version.description: This optional property sets the service API version number.

DependsOn.description: The DependsOn attribute enables you to specify that the creation of a specific resource follows another.

Name.description: The name of the domain. This must be a fully-specified domain, ending with a period as the last label indication. If you omit the final period, Amazon Route 53 assumes the domain is relative to the root.

AliasTarget.description: Alias resource record sets only: Information about the domain to which you are redirecting traffic. Required: Conditional. Required if you are creating an alias resource record set.

HostedZoneId.description: The hosted zone name ID of the Load Balancer that is the target of the alias.

DNSName.description: The DNS name of the Load Balancer that is the target of the alias.

HostedZoneName.description: The name of the domain for the hosted zone where you want to add the record set. Required: Conditional. You must specify either the HostedZoneName or HostedZoneId, but you cannot specify both.

Region.description: Latency resource record sets only: The Amazon EC2 region where the resource that is specified in this resource record set resides. The resource typically is an AWS resource, for example, Amazon EC2 instance or an Elastic Load Balancing load balancer, and is referred to by an IP address or a DNS domain name, depending on the record type.

Weight.description: Weighted resource record sets only: Among resource record sets that have the same combination of DNS name and type, a value that determines what portion of traffic for the current resource record set is routed to the associated location. Required: Conditional. Required if you are creating a weighted resource record set.

Type.description: The type of records to add.

HostedZoneId.description: The ID of the hosted zone. Required: Conditional. You must specify either the HostedZoneName or HostedZoneId, but you cannot specify both.

Comment.description: Any comments you want to include about the hosted zone.

SetIdentifier.description: A unique identifier that differentiates among multiple resource record sets that have the same combination of DNS name and type. Required: Conditional. Required if you are creating a weighted resource record set.

TTL.description: The resource record cache time to live (TTL), in seconds. If TTL is specified, ResourceRecords is also required.

ResourceRecords.description: List of resource records to add. Each record should be in the format appropriate for the record type specified by the Type property. Required: Conditional. Required if TTL is specified.

return-values.description: The connection endpoint for the database. For example: mystack-mydb-1apw1j4phylrk.cg034hpkmmjt.us-east-1.rds.amazonaws.com.
return-values.name: Endpoint.Address

return-values.description: The port number on which the database accepts connections. For example: 3306
return-values.name: Endpoint.Port

AWS::RDS::DBInstance.description: The AWS::RDS::DBInstance type creates an Amazon RDS database instance.

Type.description: The AWS::RDS::DBInstance type creates an Amazon RDS database instance.

DeletionPolicy.description: The DeletionPolicy attribute enables you to specify how AWS CloudFormation handles the resource deletion.

Metadata.description: The Metadata attribute enables you to associate structured data with a resource.

Version.description: This optional property sets the service API version number.

DependsOn.description: The DependsOn attribute enables you to specify that the creation of a specific resource follows another.

PreferredBackupWindow.description: The daily time range during which automated backups are created if automated backups are enabled, as determined by the BackupRetentionPeriod.

DBInstanceClass.description: The name of the compute and memory capacity class of the DB instance.

DBSnapshotIdentifier.description: The identifier for the DB snapshot to restore from.

AllocatedStorage.description: The allocated storage size specified in gigabytes (GB). If any value is used in the Iops parameter, AllocatedStorage must be at least 100 GB, which corresponds to the minimum Iops value of 1000. If Iops is increased (in 1000 IOPS increments), then AllocatedStorage must also be increased (in 100 GB increments) correspondingly.

Iops.description: The number of I/O operations per second (IOPS) that the database should provision. This can be any value from 1000–10,000, in 1000 IOPS increments.

AvailabilityZone.description: The name of the Availability Zone where the DB instance is. You cannot set the AvailabilityZone parameter if the MultiAZ parameter is set to true.

DBParameterGroupName.description: The name of an existing DB parameter group or a reference to an AWS::RDS::DBParameterGroup resource created in the template.

PreferredMaintenanceWindow.description: The weekly time range (in UTC) during which system maintenance can occur.

LicenseModel.description: The license model information for this DB instance.

MasterUserPassword.description: The master password for the DB instance.

Engine.description: The name of the database engine to be used for this DB instance.

MasterUsername.description: The master username for the DB instance.

DBSecurityGroups.description: A list containing the DB security groups to assign to the Amazon RDS instance. The list can contain both the name of existing DB security groups or references to AWS::RDS::DBSecurityGroup resources created in the template.

MultiAZ.description: Specifies if the DB instance is a multiple availability-zone deployment. You cannot set the AvailabilityZone parameter if the MultiAZ parameter is set to true.

EngineVersion.description: The version number of the database engine to use.

DBName.description: The name of the initial database of this instance that was provided at create time, if one was specified when the DB instance was created. This same name is returned for the life of the DB instance.

BackupRetentionPeriod.description: The number of days for which automatic DB snapshots are retained.

DBSubnetGroupName.description: A DB Subnet Group to associate with this DB instance.

AWS::EC2::NetworkAclEntry.description: Creates an entry (i.e., rule) in a network ACL with a rule number you specify. Each network ACL has a set of numbered ingress rules and a separate set of numbered egress rules.

Type.description: Creates an entry (i.e., rule) in a network ACL with a rule number you specify. Each network ACL has a set of numbered ingress rules and a separate set of numbered egress rules.

DeletionPolicy.description: The DeletionPolicy attribute enables you to specify how AWS CloudFormation handles the resource deletion.

Metadata.description: The Metadata attribute enables you to associate structured data with a resource.

Version.description: This optional property sets the service API version number.

DependsOn.description: The DependsOn attribute enables you to specify that the creation of a specific resource follows another.

CidrBlock.description: The CIDR range to allow or deny, in CIDR notation (e.g., 172.16.0.0/24).

RuleAction.description: ID of the ACL where the entry will be created.

Icmp.description: The Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) code and type.  Required: Conditional, required if specifying 1 (ICMP) for the protocol parameter.

Type.description: The Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) type. You can use -1 to specify all ICMP types. Condition: Required if specifying 1 (ICMP) for the CreateNetworkAclEntry protocol parameter.

Code.description: The Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) code. You can use -1 to specify all ICMP codes for the given ICMP type. Condition: Required if specifying 1 (ICMP) for the CreateNetworkAclEntry protocol parameter.

PortRange.description: The range of port numbers for the UDP/TCP protocol. Required: Conditional, required if specifying 6 (TCP) or 17 (UDP) for the protocol parameter.

To.description: The last port in the range. Condition: Required if specifying 6 (TCP) or 17 (UDP) for the CreateNetworkAclEntry protocol parameter.

From.description: The first port in the range. Condition: Required if specifying 6 (TCP) or 17 (UDP) for the CreateNetworkAclEntry protocol parameter.

Egress.description: Whether this rule applies to egress traffic from the subnet ("true") or ingress traffic to the subnet ("false").

NetworkAclId.description: ID of the ACL where the entry will be created.

Protocol.description: IP protocol the rule applies to. You can use -1 to mean all protocols. This must be -1 or a protocol number.

RuleNumber.description: Rule number to assign to the entry (e.g., 100). This must be a postive integer from 1 to 32766.
